meanings.definition: To move or wave back and forth
meanings.sent1: She would wedel her fingers in excitement.
meanings.sent2: The flag continued to wedel in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to wedel its tail to catch the elusive shadow.
meanings.sent4: The flames seemed to wedel and dance in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The trees appeared to wedel their branches in a gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: A type of skiing technique involving quick turns
meanings.sent1: He mastered the wedel on the ski slopes.
meanings.sent2: The instructor demonstrated the proper wedel technique.
meanings.sent3: The penguin attempted a wedel down the icy hill.
meanings.sent4: Her wedel down the mountain was swift and graceful.
meanings.sent5: The champion skier's wedel was the talk of the town.

meanings.definition: A type of dance move involving twisting the body and arms in a rhythmic motion
meanings.sent1: The dancer performed a flawless wedel during the routine.
meanings.sent2: The choreography included a challenging wedel sequence.
meanings.sent3: The wedding guests joined in a fun wedel on the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: Her wedel on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The group practiced the wedel until it was perfectly synchronized.
